terms.definition: A single-seeded indehiscent fruit derived from a single carpel.
Tapering to a long point. Usually used when describing the apex of a leaf, petal, and sepal.
The outermost layer of non-living tissue on the main stem of a woody plant.
The process by which green plants and some other organisms use sunlight to synthesize foods with the help of chlorophyll.
The transfer of pollen from the male part of a flower to the female part, enabling fertilization and reproduction.
Referring to plants that shed their leaves annually, usually in the fall.
A plant that lives for more than two years, often flowering and producing seeds multiple times.
A type of plant tissue that transports water and nutrients from the roots to the rest of the plant.
A type of plant tissue that transports sugars and other organic compounds from the leaves to the rest of the plant.
